page.title: 02The Village Green
page.content: The green is in the heart of the village. Hatfield Heath attracts many tourists, especially in the summer and you often see them having picnics. There used to be people with commoners rights who could graze their cattle on the green and there are still two people left alive who have this right. The village green suffered bomb damage during the war but luckily there is no trace of this now. On a Sunday afternoon you can sit and watch the cricket and for two days in June you can visit the festival which also takes place on the green. We have been told by one of our older residents that no other village in the country has as many roads converging on it as Hatfield Heath. These are roads from Harlow, Bishops Stortford, Takeley, Sawbridgeworth, Chelmsford and Matching.
